txt.en:
'A traveller brought word to me that Gytha Lainey is seeking your help, [placeholder]. He was given the message not long ago, and he impressed upon me the urgency of the task, though she did not convey to him its nature.

'You should go to Gytha Lainey at once! It must be something serious to have troubled so great a hunter as she.

'Look for her at Adso's Camp, on the road between Bree-town and Buckland.'

A Hunter's Charge

'Let us go, [placeholder], and quickly! If the Wargs keep their course, they will come upon the town of Overhill -- we must get there first!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>

'A traveller brought word to me that Gytha Lainey is seeking your help, [placeholder]. He was given the message not long ago, and he impressed upon me the urgency of the task, though she did not convey to him its nature.

'You should go to Gytha Lainey at once! It must be something serious to have troubled so great a hunter as she.

'Look for her at Adso's Camp, on the road between Bree-town and Buckland.'
'Gytha Lainey requested your aid with some urgent matter, [placeholder]. Go to her at once at Adso's Camp in Bree-land, on the road between Buckland and the town of Bree!'

Gytha Lainey is at Adso's Camp in Bree-land, on the road between Buckland and the town of Bree.\n\nGytha Lainey has sent word to you that she urgently needs your help.
'Gytha Lainey requested your aid with some urgent matter, [placeholder]. Go to her at once at Adso's Camp in Bree-land, on the road between Buckland and the town of Bree!'

Gytha Lainey is at Adso's Camp in Breeland, on the road between Bree-town and Buckland.\n\nGytha Lainey is waiting to speak with you and then travel into the Shire to intercept the hunting-party of Wargs that have come south in search of one of their own.
'Gytha Lainey requested your aid with some urgent matter, [placeholder]. Go to her at once at Adso's Camp in Bree-land, on the road between Buckland and the town of Bree!'

Talk to Gytha Lainey and travel into the Shire

'Thanks to you, the town of Overhill has been made safe. I am glad.'
'It was a tough thing, [placeholder], but we were able to defeat the Wargs.'

'A traveller brought word to me that Gytha Lainey is seeking your help, [placeholder]. He was given the message not long ago, and he impressed upon me the urgency of the task, though she did not convey to him its nature.

'You should go to Gytha Lainey at once! It must be something serious to have troubled so great a hunter as she.

'Look for her at Adso's Camp, on the road between Bree-town and Buckland.'
'I haven't forgotten that you helped us, [placeholder]. Thank you again!'

'A traveller brought word to me that Gytha Lainey is seeking your help, [placeholder]. He was given the message not long ago, and he impressed upon me the urgency of the task, though she did not convey to him its nature.

'You should go to Gytha Lainey at once! It must be something serious to have troubled so great a hunter as she.

'Look for her at Adso's Camp, on the road between Bree-town and Buckland.'
'You're an excellent hunter, [placeholder], and we of Overhill are grateful!'

'I'm glad you came with such haste, [placeholder], for I don't know who else I could trust to help me with this -- few hunters have proven themselves to me as you have, for the demise of Yellowfang is unmatched as proof of your worth.

'But Yellowfang is merely a pup compared to the danger of which I have learned -- a hunting-party of Wargs, a great breed of wolves, have come out of the north and are even now making their way into the lands of the Little Folk. What little I could learn from the frightened folk of the North Downs told me that these Wargs are looking for one of their number who came south and disappeared.

'This search might have brought them to the Shire, but when they find such a wealth of defenceless \qmorsels,\q they will surely forget their mission and prey upon the people there! We have to find and stop these Wargs before they reach any towns, [placeholder]! Let me know if you are ready to travel at once, and with haste!'

'I was not wrong about you this time, [placeholder], for I knew that you were up to the task at hand, and now the Wargs know it too! Though their fellow may remain missing, I do not think they will trouble the Shire again...not for a while yet.

'I charge you with this: always maintain your focus, [placeholder] -- a true hunter does not stray from her path, no matter the distraction.

'You have my thanks, Hunter [placeholder].'
In times of danger, a trained hunter might be the only one capable of finding and defeating a threat before it strikes.
